title: Young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities.
text: No i donot agree with the statement. Youngsters are now a days really looking active to spare time for helping their communities. community may mean by area ,by religion,by race and many other things. Now a days youngsters have been looking to help their home countries in a big way. I have many reasons to support my statement. In the olden days youngsters used to work hard for themselves and their families. But its different in the modern case. youngsters are being in the front row of doing service to all of their communities. They help them in all the fields. Donating blood to the people in need,helping old people , ladies in all aspects. Students are conducting welfare programmes,encouraging poor students by giving scholarships,helping the flood affected people by joining the natural disaster schemes and many more to tell. The young people who are working in corporate jobs have been sparing time on saturdays and sundays to serve the needy. They enjoy the happiness of helping in such a way. I had an example to support my statement. The following example took place in my native place guntur. A small boy who is affected with a viral fever named denguea fever is in need of blood as the blood from his body has been completely going out. So one student gave 2000 rs to that person's father and asked him to give an advertisement regarding the need for blood. As my blood group was the same i went to the hospital to donate. By the time i went there were about 800 students who came there to donate. The boy in need is not a brother or relative of anybody.

title: Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.
text: Over the last sixty years, advertising has increased in a huge way, in conjunction with the expansion of commerce-based societies. But it often occurs that we have the feeling that advertisements are a cheating on us by making some products better than they really are. Who never experienced buying something, thinking it would change his life, and being afterwards deceived by the product ? When we see a tv-advertisement, for example, we are giving us an idea of a product that doesn't always correspond to what the product really is. The only way to make this match this idea with reality is to test, and sometimes we are deceived. Why are we fooled by advertisements? The problem lies in the fact that we tend to trust what we perceive at first. An item might seem huge in the picture, but it is in reality tiny. We are also fooled by numbers. Political rhetoric in the public debate is always used by politicians who talk about percentages, but without telling the truth. For example we can say that the unemployment rate of young people is 25% percent, although it's the percentage of young people that don't follow studies. What's the goal of advertising? How would we know that a product exists if advertising didn't exist ? In fact marketing is a necessary step in the development cycle of a product. There are a number of stories in the engineering field in which an innovative technology has been created, but so little attention has been put on the marketing behind that product, and thus the advertisements, which never became known to other companies or consumers. So I agree with the subject. It occurs that we're deceived by ads, but it doesn't.
sents: ["Over the last sixty years, advertising has increased in a huge way, in conjunction with the expansion of commerce-based societies. But it often occurs that we have the feeling that advertisements are a cheating on us by making some products better than they really are. Who never experienced buying something, thinking it would change his life, and being afterwards deceived by the product ? When we see a tv-advertisement, for example, we are giving us an idea of a product that doesn't always correspond to what the product really is. The only way to make this match this idea with reality is to test, and sometimes we are deceived. Why are we fooled by advertisements? Political rhetoric in the public debate is always used by politicians who talk about percentages, but without telling the truth. For example we can say that the unemployment rate of young people is 25% percent, although it's the percentage of young people that don't follow studies. What's the goal of advertising? How would we know that a product exists if advertising didn't exist ? In fact marketing is a necessary step in the development cycle of a product. There are a number of stories in the engineering field in which an innovative technology has been created, but so little attention has been put on the marketing behind that product, and thus the advertisements, which never became known to other companies or consumers. So I agree with the subject.", "It occurs that we're deceived by ads, but it doesn't."]

title: Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.
text: I agree with the opinion that people succeed more often when they try new things and take risks, rather than only doing what they are already familiar with. There are two reasons for this: motivation and chances. First, when people try something that can be challenging for them, they are motivated. In fact, they try their best. When people try their best, they have more chance of succeeding. However, when people do something that they know how to do well, they do not try their best because they already know what the limit is and what they can do with it. However, when people try new things, they are motivated to learn more about them. Also, they do not yet know how far they can go with it, so they are motivated to know what they can do. Second, when people try new things, they have more chances to encounter something that is in their interest but did not know about the existence of. What they already know how to do well is probably something that other people already know and is familiar to all of them.

title: Young people enjoy life more than older people do.
text: Young people are full of energy and in possession of an active body and a healthy mind. They really enjoy life much more than older people. who are weak and frail. Young people can go for what they want to do. They have the vigour, stamina, active brain, sound health and energy to achieve their goals. While, senility makes a person dull and it also comes with many diseases, which leave their body inactive. If a young person has a desire to take a world tour then he can go for it. But, such ideas have to "nipped in the bud" by older people. They will not enjoy such an adventure, but will create problems for them and their relatives. You are in demand if you are in the possession of a young body, a young soul. That makes life enjoyable for a young person. He feels he is wanted by society, by friends and family. On the other hand, older people are ignored by most of them. Most of the time they have to either read something or sit infront of theTV. These all tasks make their life a bore. Older people's lives are like a train which has got an engine only and that engine is also malfunctioned and can stall anytime.

title: Young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities.
text: I think the community has to help itself, it is not only a moral obligation of young people! What do you mean for young people? Teenagers? A 30-year-old man is still young, but he is not a young man for the community! All people have to give time to helping the community! All the people do not care about others, only a few people, like the men who go to Africa to help the poor populations! They give all their life to helping the community. As you can see they are not young people, so all the people do not give time to helping, above all the young  people. But now society is different, it is not like 50 years ago, there's been a lot of changes, people need different things, nowadays a young man needs to study, to realise himself! How can I help a person if I do not feel well? I have to realise myself, I have to study, sometimes I have to relax, sometimes I need to have fun. Young people are a particular kind of people, but I think they are the most important part, they are the future, so they have to realise themselves and one day they will be able to help other people, but not today, it is not the most important thing now; the old men can help the others, because they do not have other things to do, now they can use what they learn in the past! May be in the past young people had more responsibilities , I do not know, and I could not, but as I said before, time has changed, time is a circle, today it is your turn, tomorrow it will be mine.

title: In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
text: In the past few decades cars have been the most useful vehicle in the world. The use of cars is still increasing rapidly. There are many people saying the negative aspect s of cars, though I think the increase in car use will go on in the next twenty years or maybe more. The carbon dioxide which is emitted from those cars is said to be a big cause of global warming. This negative aspect should be prevented, but there are still a large share of cars. Why cannot people use trains and other social transport. In that way car users will be decreasing and it will be good for the environment. When I was still a child and did not have a driver's license I thought the pollution the car makes was evil and something that one needs to prevent. After a few years when I got the license the thought of pollution went somewhere else from my mind. It is just so useful. I think cars are like smoking. We know that this is a bad habit. Despite this fact, people just cannot quit it. The usefulness of cars affects the people. No one wants to be on a bus or a train when you see the people on there getting squashed and missable. We think we will use the car,more privately and more conveniently. I believe cars will not decrease forever. People cannot prevent th e desire to use such useful things so we need to think of another way, like inventing a car that is ecological. The amount of car share will be increasing as the population rises.
sents: ["In the past few decades cars have been the most useful vehicle in the world. The use of cars is still increasing rapidly. There are many people saying the negative aspect s of cars, though I think the increase in car use will go on in the next twenty years or maybe more. The carbon dioxide which is emitted from those cars is said to be a big cause of global warming. This negative aspect should be prevented, but there are still a large share of cars. Why cannot people use trains and other social transport. In that way car users will be decreasing and it will be good for the environment. When I was still a child and did not have a driver's license I thought the pollution the car makes was evil and something that one needs to prevent. After a few years when I got the license the thought of pollution went somewhere else from my mind. It is just so useful. I think cars are like smoking. We know that this is a bad habit. Despite this fact, people just cannot quit it. The usefulness of cars affects the people. No one wants to be on a bus or a train when you see the people on there getting squashed and missable. We think we will use the car,more privately and more conveniently. I believe cars will not decrease forever. People cannot prevent th e desire to use such useful things so we need to think of another way, like inventing a car that is ecological.", 'The amount of car share will be increasing as the population rises.']

title: Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.
text: Nowadays, there are many people who believe that only doing what they already know how to do well is true. Nevertheless, I absolutely disagree with this point completely. I think that successful people try things and take risks to become successful. There are many successful people who also take many high risks before they / become successful and well-known. Bill Gates is a typical example in this situation. When Bill Gates was still a student at university, he realized that he would be a great man and hired by a big company with a great amount and stable salary after he graduated. Although he realized that situation, he still decided to take a risk to abandon his studies and started to invent some software. Moreover, he asked one of his friends to abandon studying and go with him to create a business. Nevertheless, he rejected it eventually. A few years later, Bill Gates became the richest man in the world with several millions of dollars. On the other hand, although his friend graduated from the University of oxford, he was only a manager of a small company. An other example is my father, he was not skillful at studying when he was young:therefore, he started to create his own business instead of studying or working for a company for many years. Now he is a very successful person and my idol. In conclusion, I think people should try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well. It is because if we are not skillful at studying or working for others, why do we have to waste our precious time doing things without any result. Moreover, I think people should try new things when they are young, because it is useful to regret them when they become old.

title: The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.
text: I am completely positive about the statement. Here i would like to mention some reasons why group travel is the best way to travel. I work for a travel company as a tour guide, so i guess i confirm the advantages of group travelling. First of all, tourists feel secure when they are travelling with plenty of people and their guide, who is a local resident of the site. Group travelling people can defend themselves in difficult times and it is more likely to attract public attention for requesting help. In some places, it is suggested to tourists not to go out alone because of the high velocity rate. The second reason why i prefer group travel is payment for the travel costs. Needless to say, it is noticably cheaper than single travel for certain countries. Even a number of tour companies offer special programmes for group tourists, not only discounts, but also free-of-charge trips for group leaders or a certain number of members. The third reason serves our company's main goal, More people, more fun. It is very interesting to travel with many different people in order to have a real vacation. Group tourists can attend different competitions, matches and other attractive entertainment. Travelling is not only the meaning of travelling, but of making friends and getting relationships with them.
